result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetri Obrian Hollimon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Demetri Obrian Hollimon.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion to Adjourn. Discussion placed on the record. State provided update to the Court regarding Motion to Adjourn due to essential witness availability. Defense did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Motion hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 16.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Adjourn.  Received and Filed. nk
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE TO DEFENDANTS MOTION TO SUPPRESS

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, by zoom, defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and filed motion to suppress evidence.  State has until September 15, 2022 to file motion response.  Case scheduled for in-person Motion Hearing; State to file order to produce.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case in court for a scheduling conference. Case completed off the record. Attorney John Rejowski appeared for the State and Attorney Stephen Sargent appeared for defense. Case was supposed to be tabbed to Judge Grayson, NOT Judge Feiss. Court retabbed case onto Judge Grayson's calendar. Court scheduled next court date with parties. Case adjourned to Branch 16, for a scheduling conference on July 8th, 2022 at 9:30 am.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon not in court, in custody. Jon Josephsen appeared for John Rejowski for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines. Defense has until June 17th, 2022, to file any motions. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING (13  pages) commencing 05-11-22 by Kathleen S. Wooden.

Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon in court, defendant in custody with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judicial Notice of 20CF3837. Sworn for the State: Glendale Office A. Bechler.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon in court with Student Intern Laura Federico under the supervision of Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Demetri Obrian Hollimon in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetri Obrian Hollimon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
